snippet: Dozens of people were killed Tuesday by a suicide bomber in an area of eastern Afghanistan where members of the Shinwari tribe have long been engaged in internal tribal warfare.
abstract: At least 25 mourners are killed as a suicide bomber strikes a funeral in eastern Afghanistan; area is populated by members of the Shinwari tribe, which has been engaged in longstanding internal tribal warfare and conflict with Taliban insurgents in the mountainous area.

byline.original: By KHALID ALOKOZAY and ROD NORDLAND
byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Dozens of people were killed Tuesday by a suicide bomber in an area of eastern Afghanistan where members of the Shinwari tribe have long been engaged in internal tribal warfare.

headline.seo: Bomber Kills at Least 25 at Afghan Funeral
headline.main: Bomber Kills at Least 25 at Afghan Funeral
headline.print_headline: Bomber Kills at Least 25 at Afghan Funeral
